rules.natural: Provided that a tool uses a platform, the platform is operational.

If a tool has a license on a platform, then: assuming it is not the case that (if it is not the case that the platform is not operational implies the publication is not approved) then the publication is published, it follows that the publication is not rejected.
Whenever a publication violates legislation, it is censored by the platform.
Either a publication violates legislation or the platform is operational.
Provided that a publication is removed from a platform, it does not hold that the publication is censored by the platform.
Whenever a platform issues a removal for a publication, a court orders a removal for the publication.
Either a platform issues a removal for a publication or a regulator issues a takedown for a publication.
Under the condition that a regulator issues a takedown for a publication, then: if a publication violates legislation, it is removed from the platform.
If a court orders a removal for a publication, an authority enforces a removal of the publication.
If an agency monitors compliance of a platform, then: provided that an authority enforces a removal of a publication, whenever a publication violates legislation, it is removed from the platform.
A user reports a violation of a publication or a reader reports a concern about a publication.

Provided that a reader reports a concern about a publication, then: if a tool detects a violation in a publication, either the platform is compliant with legislation or the publication does not require a law exemption.

If an authority receives a complaint about a platform, then: assuming it is not the case that (if a user reports a violation of a publication then whenever a tool detects a violation in a publication, either the platform is compliant with legislation or the publication does not require a law exemption), an authority investigates a publication.
Either an authority upholds a complaint about a platform or it is not the case that an authority dismisses a complaint about a platform.
Whenever an authority imposes a sanction on a platform, an authority does not uphold a complaint about a platform.
If an authority fines a platform, the authority imposes a sanction on the platform.
An authority fines a platform or an authority suspends a platform.
Provided that an authority suspends a platform, the authority imposes a sanction on the platform.
Provided that an author resubmits a publication, the publication is published on the platform.
If a lawyer supports an appeal by an author, then: provided that an author files an appeal with a platform, whenever an author appeals a publication, the author resubmits the publication.
Under the condition that a tool modifies content, either the platform is compliant with legislation or the publication does not require a law exemption.
A tool modifies content or a tool analyzes data.
If a tool analyzes data, a tool detects a violation in a publication.
Provided that an author submits a publication, an editor validates content.
If an editor reviews a publication, then: whenever a tool analyzes data, either the platform is compliant with legislation or the publication does not require a law exemption.
Provided that an editor validates content, an editor reviews the publication.

If it is not the case that (if it is not the case that the platform is not operational implies the publication is not approved) then the publication is published, the publication is rejected by the platform.
If it is not the case that the platform is not operational implies the publication is not approved, an author appeals a publication.
Under the condition that it is not the case that the platform is not operational implies the publication is not approved, the publication is not published on the platform.
Provided that a tool does not use a platform, a publication requires a law exemption.
If an authority does not receive a complaint about a platform, an authority dismisses a complaint about the platform.
Whenever a platform is not operational, a publication is approved by a platform.

An authority does not investigate a publication.
The platform is not compliant with legislation.

(A1 → G).natural: Provided that a tool uses a platform, the platform is operational.

(A12 → (¬(¬(¬G → ¬A9) → A10) → ¬A11)).natural: If a tool has a license on a platform, then: assuming it is not the case that (if it is not the case that the platform is not operational implies the publication is not approved) then the publication is published, it follows that the publication is not rejected.

(A13 → A14).natural: Whenever a publication violates legislation, it is censored by the platform.

(A13 → A15).natural: Under the condition that a publication violates legislation, it is removed from the platform.

(A13 → ¬A14).natural: If a publication violates legislation, then it is not the case that the publication is censored by the platform.

(A13 ∨ G).natural: Either a publication violates legislation or the platform is operational.

(A15 → ¬A14).natural: Provided that a publication is removed from a platform, it does not hold that the publication is censored by the platform.

(A16 → (A13 → A15)).natural: If a platform issues a removal for a publication, then: whenever a publication violates legislation, it is removed from the platform.

(A16 → A18).natural: Whenever a platform issues a removal for a publication, a court orders a removal for the publication.

(A16 ∨ A17).natural: Either a platform issues a removal for a publication or a regulator issues a takedown for a publication.

(A17 → (A13 → A15)).natural: Under the condition that a regulator issues a takedown for a publication, then: if a publication violates legislation, it is removed from the platform.

(A18 → (A13 → A15)).natural: Provided that a court orders a removal for a publication, then: whenever a publication violates legislation, it is removed from the platform.

(A18 → A19).natural: If a court orders a removal for a publication, an authority enforces a removal of the publication.

(A19 → (A13 → A15)).natural: Provided that an authority enforces a removal of a publication, then: under the condition that a publication violates legislation, it is removed from the platform.

(A20 → (A19 → (A13 → A15))).natural: If an agency monitors compliance of a platform, then: provided that an authority enforces a removal of a publication, whenever a publication violates legislation, it is removed from the platform.

(A21 → (A3 ∨ ¬A2)).natural: Under the condition that a tool detects a violation in a publication, either the platform is compliant with legislation or the publication does not require a law exemption.

(A22 → (A21 → (A3 ∨ ¬A2))).natural: If a user reports a violation of a publication, then: whenever a tool detects a violation in a publication, either the platform is compliant with legislation or the publication does not require a law exemption.

(A22 ∨ A23).natural: A user reports a violation of a publication or a reader reports a concern about a publication.

(A23 → (A21 → (A3 ∨ ¬A2))).natural: Provided that a reader reports a concern about a publication, then: if a tool detects a violation in a publication, either the platform is compliant with legislation or the publication does not require a law exemption.

(A25 → (¬(A22 → (A21 → (A3 ∨ ¬A2))) → A2.natural: If an authority receives a complaint about a platform, then: assuming it is not the case that (if a user reports a violation of a publication then whenever a tool detects a violation in a publication, either the platform is compliant with legislation or the publication does not require a law exemption), an authority investigates a publication.

(A27 ∨ ¬A26).natural: Either an authority upholds a complaint about a platform or it is not the case that an authority dismisses a complaint about a platform.

(A28 → ¬A27).natural: Whenever an authority imposes a sanction on a platform, an authority does not uphold a complaint about a platform.

(A29 → A28).natural: If an authority fines a platform, the authority imposes a sanction on the platform.

(A29 ∨ A30).natural: An authority fines a platform or an authority suspends a platform.

(A3 ∨ ¬A2).natural: Either the platform is compliant with legislation or the publication does not require a law exemption.

(A30 → A28).natural: Provided that an authority suspends a platform, the authority imposes a sanction on the platform.

(A31 → A10).natural: Under the condition that an author appeals a publication, the publication is published on the platform.

(A31 → A32).natural: If an author appeals a publication, the author resubmits the publication.

(A32 → A10).natural: Provided that an author resubmits a publication, the publication is published on the platform.

(A33 → (A31 → A32)).natural: Whenever an author files an appeal with a platform, then: if an author appeals a publication, the author resubmits the publication.

(A34 → (A33 → (A31 → A32))).natural: If a lawyer supports an appeal by an author, then: provided that an author files an appeal with a platform, whenever an author appeals a publication, the author resubmits the publication.

(A4 → (A3 ∨ ¬A2)).natural: Under the condition that a tool modifies content, either the platform is compliant with legislation or the publication does not require a law exemption.

(A4 ∨ A5).natural: A tool modifies content or a tool analyzes data.

(A5 → (A3 ∨ ¬A2)).natural: Provided that a tool analyzes data, either the platform is compliant with legislation or the publication does not require a law exemption.

(A5 → A21).natural: If a tool analyzes data, a tool detects a violation in a publication.

(A6 → (A5 → (A3 ∨ ¬A2))).natural: Whenever an author submits a publication, then: if a tool analyzes data, either the platform is compliant with legislation or the publication does not require a law exemption.

(A6 → A7).natural: Under the condition that an author submits a publication, an editor reviews the publication.

(A6 → A8).natural: Provided that an author submits a publication, an editor validates content.

(A7 → (A5 → (A3 ∨ ¬A2))).natural: If an editor reviews a publication, then: whenever a tool analyzes data, either the platform is compliant with legislation or the publication does not require a law exemption.

(A8 → A7).natural: Provided that an editor validates content, an editor reviews the publication.

(¬(A22 → (A21 → (A3 ∨ ¬A2))) → A24).natural: Assuming it is not the case that (if a user reports a violation of a publication then whenever a tool detects a violation in a publication, either the platform is compliant with legislation or the publication does not require a law exemption), an authority investigates a publication.

(¬(¬(¬G → ¬A9) → A10) → A11).natural: If it is not the case that (if it is not the case that the platform is not operational implies the publication is not approved) then the publication is published, the publication is rejected by the platform.

(¬(¬(¬G → ¬A9) → A10) → ¬A11).natural: Provided that it is not the case that (if it is not the case that the platform is not operational implies the publication is not approved) then the publication is published, it does not hold that the publication is rejected by the platform.

(¬(¬G → ¬A9) → A10).natural: Whenever it is not the case that the platform is not operational implies the publication is not approved, the publication is published on the platform.

(¬(¬G → ¬A9) → A31).natural: If it is not the case that the platform is not operational implies the publication is not approved, an author appeals a publication.

(¬(¬G → ¬A9) → ¬A10).natural: Under the condition that it is not the case that the platform is not operational implies the publication is not approved, the publication is not published on the platform.

(¬A1 → A2).natural: Provided that a tool does not use a platform, a publication requires a law exemption.

(¬A25 → A26).natural: If an authority does not receive a complaint about a platform, an authority dismisses a complaint about the platform.

(¬G → A9).natural: Whenever a platform is not operational, a publication is approved by a platform.

(¬G → ¬A9).natural: Under the condition that a platform is not operational, it is not the case that a publication is approved by a platform.

A12.natural: A tool has a license on a platform.

A20.natural: An agency monitors compliance of a platform.

A25.natural: An authority receives a complaint about a platform.

A28.natural: An authority imposes a sanction on a platform.

A33.natural: An author files an appeal with a platform.

A34.natural: A lawyer supports an appeal by an author.

¬A13.natural: It is not the case that a publication violates legislation.

¬A2.natural: A publication does not require a law exemption.

¬A24.natural: An authority does not investigate a publication.

¬A26.natural: It is not the case that an authority dismisses a complaint about a platform.

¬A27.natural: An authority does not uphold a complaint about a platform.

¬A3.natural: The platform is not compliant with legislation.
